title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9000.4 - Fees for services
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9000.4 - Fees for services

State Regulations
(a) It is
the policy of the authority to provide routine information and to permit public
inspection of record without charge. Fees may be charged in the following
situations: (1)
reproduction, duplication or
copying of records; and
(2)
where a
fee is otherwise prescribed by law. (b) Records will be photocopied by the
authority if practicable. The person requesting a copy will be charged a fee of
25 cents per page for copies not exceeding 9 x 14 inches, or the actual cost or
reproducing such records if larger copies are required. If it is not
practicable for the authority to photocopy any such record, it will be copied
commercially and the person requesting the copy will be charged a fee equal to
the cost of such commercial reproduction. (c) Any fee charged by the authority pursuant
to this Part shall be paid by the person making the request, by certified check
or bank cashier's check, or, in the sole discretion of the authority, by cash, in advance of the delivery of copies of any record referred to in this

Part. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
9000.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
